publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Šorčuqduring T III Š 63.12

seg.seg: ... The Yakṣa says: "You will probably not be able to give the price I ask of you. But if you should indeed be able to give up your
The yakṣa says, «you cannot afford the price I request from you, can you?» (cf )
If you are able to give this up, … I will give you (the law) to hear.

(Der Yakṣa) spricht: "Du wirst wohl nicht imstande sein, den Preis zu geben, den ich von dir verlange. Wenn du aber doch imstande sein solltest, das hinzugeben, dann werde ich dir ... (einen buddhistischen Śloka) zu hören geben.
(The Yakṣa) says: " ... (a Buddhist Śloka) to hear.
(life ... then) I will give you (a Śloka) to hear." The king says: "Seeing something with [one's own] eyes [is] superior [if] there has arisen doubt about it." The Yakṣa says:
a4 If you are able to enter this horrible fire hut that makes [you] feel aversion, then I will recite your Buddha strophe.
If you are able to enter this horrible fire hut that makes [you] feel aversion, then I will recite your Buddha strophe.
Teacher, without hesitation I enter into the fire hut ... (but) if I enter into the fire first, my wish

Teacher, without hesitation I enter into the fire hut … (but) if I enter into the fire first, my wish to hear the dear law with a Buddha-strophe cannot be fulfilled. First give me the law to hear with faithful mind! (cf 29)
to hear the dear law with a Buddha-strophe cannot be fulfilled. First give me the law to hear with faithful mind!" The yakṣa says, "O great king, (it is) more than difficult
– you fool me [about] your entering the fire, don’t you?"
I cannot be put off my resolution.
I can/will not be put off my resolution.
Grand roi, sois prêt à entendre le joyau de la Loi.

p.note: The leaf has many misspelled vowels and also some hypercorrect spellings such as ‹au› for ‹o›: tsäṅkauṣepi (). Anusvara is also often missing.
Thomas in 252 proposes the likely restoration pañaktäññe ślok while 105 translated "the Law".
Restoration according to Sieg/Siegling in 36, fn. 3.
Restoration according to Sieg/Siegling in 36, fn. 6.

The leaf has many misspelled vowels and also some hypercorrect spellings such as ‹au› for ‹o›: tsäṅkauṣepi (a2). Anusvara is also often missing.

a2 Thomas in [[TochSprR(B)2]]: 252 proposes the likely restoration pañaktäññe ślok while [[Couvreur 1954c]]: 105 translated "the Law".
a2 Restoration according to Sieg/Siegling in [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 36, fn. 3.
a3 Restoration according to Sieg/Siegling in [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 36, fn. 6.

Alternative classifications:
Peyrot–
Malzahn–
TamaiII-3 (800-900)
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1 The yakṣa says, «you cannot afford the price I request from you, can you?» (cf ) 365
a1-2 If you are able to give this up, … I will give you (the law) to hear. 344
a4 If you are able to enter this horrible fire hut that makes [you] feel aversion, then I will recite your Buddha strophe. 312
a5-6 Teacher, without hesitation I enter into the fire hut … (but) if I enter into the fire first, my wish to hear the dear law with a Buddha-strophe cannot be fulfilled. First give me the law to hear with faithful mind! (cf [[Thomas 1952]]: 29) 316
b2 I can/will not be put off my resolution. 342

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1-2 (Der Yakṣa) spricht: "Du wirst wohl nicht imstande sein, den Preis zu geben, den ich von dir verlange. Wenn du aber doch imstande sein solltest, das hinzugeben, dann werde ich dir ... (einen buddhistischen Śloka) zu hören geben. 152

a1 /// (yākṣe) weṣṣäṃ mapi mā ca(mpät) cau|c(e)_u pito rintsi|rīntsī k_uce ñiś ñäskau-c-meṃ : kwri|kr_ui no tu rintsi|rī«ṃ»tsi cämpalle|campalle tākat tañ|ta|(ñ) a2 /// (kl)y(au)ṣtsi ayu-c || walo weṣṣäṃ sklok tsäṅk{o}ṣepi wäntarentse yneś lkālñe|lkālyñe śpālmeṃ || yākṣe weṣṣäṃ • a3 /// – rä – – arwāṃts|arwāts apiśäṣṣe|avīśäṣṣe au(rtsesa |pitka orotstsai|o)rotsai koṣkai yāmtsi kwri|kr_ui tā_u ṣe sleme tatākausai a4 /// – mrauskäṣṣeñcai empelyai pwārṣṣai koṣkain(e – – – – –) tākat tañiś tañ pañaktäññe ślauk aksau ka a5 /// – weṣṣäṃ käṣṣi snai nerke yänmaskau pwārṣṣai|pwārṣai koṣkaine – (– – – pwarne|puwa)rne nauṣ yopu mā ṣpä akālk knelle star-ñ pañaktä a6 /// lareṃ pelaikne klyautsi pelaikne klyauṣtsi nauṣ pete-ñ tak(·) – – (–) – || yā(kṣ)e weṣṣäṃ oroccu walo amāskaimeṃ amās(k)ai b1 /// ·(·) pwarne|puwarne yaptsi mapi tserentar-ñ || smimane walo weṣṣäṃ || ta(ruṇa)divāka(rne) || # walo ṣleṃts|ṣlentso , śpālmeṃ su ; pittsau menāk , b2 %3 /// ; p(lu)wi teteka : #1a pwārmeṃ laṃññi , krostaṃñe ; war karītsñe , rīñit(rä) ; (– – – –) %3 (··)s(·) %1 ññ(·) %1 : #1b mā ñiś pratinmeṃ ; klyautkalyñe nesau : #1c tusāksa nai , b3 %5 /// -ñ klyauṣtsi , wakice|wakīce ; ślok pūdñaktäññ(e) || #1d (– – – – –) taisa wat no riññi onolmi lāntne eṅkältsa kälymiṃ pä b4 /// t(·)i ram no ecce mänte keṃtsa spalkaṣyeṃ (– – – – –) taisa iknekne läkleṣṣana rekaunasa snai keś a b5 /// weṣtsa ylaiñakte lāntaś weṣṣäṃ oroccu walo ārwer ptāka pelaikneṣṣe naumiye klyauṣtsi || tumeṃ b6 /// pelaikneṃtse yarke yāmtsi • lauke tattārmeṃ laṃntuñeṃ yetweṃ amāṃ śāmpa añcalī ṣarne yāmu

a1 ... The Yakṣa says: "You will probably not be able to give the price I ask of you. But if you should indeed be able to give up your a2 (life ... then) I will give you (a Śloka) to hear." The king says: "Seeing something with [one's own] eyes [is] superior [if] there has arisen doubt about it." The Yakṣa says: a3 a4 If you are able to enter this horrible fire hut that makes [you] feel aversion, then I will recite your Buddha strophe. a5 Teacher, without hesitation I enter into the fire hut ... (but) if I enter into the fire first, my wish a6 to hear the dear law with a Buddha-strophe cannot be fulfilled. First give me the law to hear with faithful mind!" The yakṣa says, "O great king, (it is) more than difficult b1 – you fool me [about] your entering the fire, don’t you?" b2 I cannot be put off my resolution. b5 Grand roi, sois prêt à entendre le joyau de la Loi.
